content:
Soup is a bit salty but it's clear, fresh and non greasy, noodle is not bad but I personally like the thick knife cut style noodle. 

The beef wrap is delicious, a must try, clean environment and friendly serice, reasonably priced for a bowl of beef noodle in Taipei. 

Overall good experience for me here.
Cheap steak, tummy filler with refillable soft drinks
Hiding inside an alley way, hygenie aside, this place serves up some of the best local bento with friendly pricing.
Cold noodle is delicious, black sesame sauce with vinegar goes well together.

Great HK style yum cha restaurant with clean environment and friendly service, every dish tastes above average, I especially like the sesame ball filled with black sesame filling inside, hot liquid black lava oozed out when you cut it open. Yummm.

place: ä¿¡æ—¥æœ¬æ–™ç† California and Japanese Food Cuisine
content: Fresh seafood, great salmon Don rice. Only costs NT$110 friendly owner and unbeatable value. Highly recommended.
Peking duck is delicious, juicy and crispy with soft wrapper, fill it with fresh cucumber and spring onion plus a dash of sweet plum sauce, so good. Recommend the duck dish.
Typical HK service, traditional HK style food, not my cup of tea.
HK style yum cha should be way better than this, price is expensive and service is mediocre.
Delicious soup dumpling place at heart of Taipei city, price is cheaper than famous Ding Tai Fung restaurant but taste is very similar. Worth a visit!
Pretty nice noodle Shop, clean, wallet friendly and generous portion.

Amazing little pizza and pasta joint, the pizza is a must order, generous topping with fresh cheese, thin and crispy crust. Very delicious, owner is friendly and talkative, definitely will come back for second visit.

Not so much selection compare with other same class buffet restaurant but the quality of each dish is exceptional, sashimi is fresh and finely sliced, dessert is delicate and chocolate fondue is decadent. wash it all down with all you can drink red or white house wine. Delicious ....

House specialty is knife thick cut noodle, noodle is cooked just right, chewy, not too soft and still can bite through with ease, sauce is a bit salty for my taste, generous portion with friendly price tag, about TW$80 ~ 110 per serving. I enjoyed it very much and will definitely come back for second visit.

Cheap steak house close to Ximen area but the quality of the dishes are not cheap at all and the portion is unbelievable,  I can't hardly finish my main dish as a mature adult. A good place to visit for a hearty meal.

Note: price increased by about 15%. - 2019/05
Average bread shop with above average interior decoration.
Interior design is great, food itself is not bad, I find it a bit over salty and greasy, it's better to have a group dinner here so you can try different dishes.
Visually it's a challenge to pick this restaurant for food, but if you can conquer your fear, this is one tasty vegetarian restaurant that you might not find elsewhere  in Taipei.

The best laksa in Taipei for me so far, the brothe is spicy and flavourful from the spices and herbs, the coconut cream gives it a smoother texture and adds a bit of sweetness too. 

The fry chicken is succulent and delicious but not â€¦

Delicious beef noodle, meat is tender and flavourful, noodle and dumplings are chewy but still can bite through it with ease. Price is a little bit over, TW$50 for a bowl of spring onion flavoured noodle which only has literally only noodle and sauce.

This Chinese restaurant is specialised in Guangdong cuisine and chef knows exactly how to make it right, the dishes are delicious and not overly salty or greasy. Clean and bright interior. A great place to host a friend's gathering or company event where you also can enjoy a decent meal.
The Udon noodle quality from this place is on par with those Japanese restaurant, it's chewy and firm. Very delicious and only costs TW$90 to $140 depending on the type of Udon you choose.
Formerly this place was a village for military personnel's family, a great place to learn about the history and experience the culture.

A nice little Vietnamese restaurant inside Tongwah night market, the shop is bright and clean, I tried their pho and it was delicious,  you can taste the hotness from the chilli, sourness from fresh lime or lemon juice, fresh basil adds aromatic sensation.
Burgers are better than evil clown(Steven King calls it "It", I call it McD), but in terms of nutritional value is the same. They are being called junk food for a reason.

The hot and spicy Taiwanese stinky tofu tastes good with firm texture and the air pockets inside the tofu is filled with flavourful soup. A little bit too salty for my personally taste but it goes down well with a bowl of steamy hot white rice.
Both sticky rice sausage and Taiwanese sausage tastes pretty good, basically it's a hotdog but replaced the bread with sticky rice sausage. mediocre.....
Nice little teppanyaki restaurant where you can get decent food, great portion and wallet friendly price.
Used to be so much better, dishes still taste great without a doubt. But something has changed.

This shop brings back my old childhood memory, I can find the candy or cheap toys I used to play or able to get when I was young in this retro style convenience store. You can also find some local souvenirs here as well.
Great place to visit, although the old street is a bit too short and no other place to go after the old main street, I still enjoyed my time there.
Around TW$50 for a cup of mung bean milk shake or taro milk shake, both tastes delicious, but personally I think its a bit too sweet.
If you are a taro fanatic, you can try the taro ball offered by this tiny stand. I am not a taro fan but still willing to give it a 4 star.
Char grilled tofu with house special sauce, tofu is nice and firm but not overwhelmingly special.

Must buy the fermented tofu products in this shop, this local condiment can transform a boring and flavorless white rice or congee into something amazing. Personally I like their spicy  fermented tofu but original one is also good.

One little cozy and delicious spring onion pancake and chive pasty box, spring onion pancake is aromatic and lightly flavored, you can taste the freshness of the spring onion and the pancake itself is chewy and none greasy. The side dishes â€¦

One of the best bite size boneless crispy fried pork I tried in Taipei, it's not a typical fried pork nuggets where you eat it straight up. This Taiwan local delicacy is served in a well seasoned soup.

Outer crispy shell is covered in â€¦

It is hard to find a healthy food restaurant that tastes this good. It is not a vegan only restaurant, but their ideology is to provide meals with lesser salt and fat. They also try to promote low-GI diet which is very rare to find in â€¦
Delicious local delicacy, you can buy meat bun, man tou or sweet red bean bun here. Price is cheap and suitable for a quick meal or a snack on the go.

A decent noodle house, they used thick cut noodles for their dishes but how they cook it failed to reach my expectation, a bit overcooked and became soggy. I ordered the chilli beef dry noodle, a little bit greasy but taste was good.
Delicious Japanese style eel rice bento (unagidon) fish is fresh and grilled to perfection with in house unagi sauce. Highly recommended for tourists.
Old style HK yum cha restaurant, waw not many yum cha restaurant uses steam trolley to serve food anymore, but this place still kept the old tradition. Food is good and the price is reasonable.
Mediocre Korean restaurant in Taipei, the taste is not that authentic, but the price is  cheap with all you can eat side dishes, a wide range of sides to choose from at the counter area.
Delicious Chinese herbal lamp soup and chicken rice inside Tong wah night market. The soup is mild in flavour and not too greasy.
Loved their think cut noodle, it's chewy and delicious but the price is a bit expensive and strongly recommend them to improve their hygiene.

Yayoi is a chain restaurant offers Japanese set menu dishes to customer. The environment is clean and tidy, food itself tastes good but unfortunately nothing too special.

Similar feeling when you walked into a McDonald's for a burger ...
Their hot and spicy wonton noodle is delicious, a little bit expensive compared with other noodle restaurant around that area but high price is compensated by the quality of the dishes.

Only the best local ingredients are used to prepare their curry dish and you can actually tasted it. The quality is exceptional and taste is amazing. They support local farmers and make use of every resources here in Taiwan trying to make â€¦
Delicious Taiwanese style fry rice and spicy wonton, I can't say the price is cheap but fair. Good hygiene and clean kitchen. Definitely will come back again to try out other menu.
Authentic Taiwanese dessert shop selling sweet red bean, peanut and herbal jelly soup. You can also select your favourite sides to go with your soup base.

such a comfortable and cozy cafe style restaurant located into wuxin market. They serve high quality and huge portion sandwiches based meal ranging from BLT to Philly steak sandwich.

I tried the BLT, all the major components were there, â€¦

A burger joint where you can read comic books or play board games with friends together, as for the food, the burger is nice, the meat patty is soft and juicy. Sadly it doesn't come with any vege in the burger, curry rice is average, sauce is a bit salty. Overall still a good place to hang out with friends.

The spirit of hot pot is in the soup, that is exactly right, a good broth makes hot pot much more tasty and enjoyable. This shop sells single serving hot pot and their house special chicken broth as soup base. Before you choose your soup â€¦

Not an ordinary Steamed Vermicelli Roll that you would find in HK yum-cha restaurant, this shop makes their roll on demand from fine grained rice batter, then poured on a steam tray with fresh vegetables and pork mince. Before serving they will pour a light soy based sauce on top. Very healthy, delicious.

This so called "Cat's ear" is a type of noodle made from small piece of noodle dough and shaped it into a cat ear like noodle. This shop cooks it to perfection, the noodle itself is chewy and not too soggy, they also used a house special â€¦
Year of the boar should get something pig like bread to eat, cute piggy head bread tastes good and fluffy.

This place offers NT$350 healthy buffet for lunch where you can select a wild varieties of seasonal vegetables and fruits, quality is good and taste is exceptional. Commercial lunch costs around NT$200 to $400 depends on your main dish â€¦

Just found a great place to hang out with friends or having a after-work causal drink with colleagues, this yakitori place has all you can eat rice and the wide ranges of meat skewers you can choose from, needless to say they have a range â€¦
Means "Hope" in Japanese symbolizes good things will happen and it did, the bread and cakes here are amazing, creamy filling not too sweet and the bread itself is soft and fluffy. Delicious.

address: 109 Repulse Bay Road, Repulse Bay, é¦™æ¸¯
content: Very nice location to host special events, great view and friendly services provided by the staff here.

Awesome char grill sandwiches shop which also serves don rice with grilled chicken or pork. The meat is marinated in delicious house special sauce and when you opened the sandwich up, runny egg yolk oozed out. A nice place to have a quick â€¦

This steam dumpling place is not as well known as Din Tai Fung, but the steam bun here are out of this world, its fresh, juicy and delicious. Needless to say, the price here is much friendlier than Din Tai Fung!

NT$40 for a spring onion â€¦

NT$140 for a cheese cake that is filled with fresh fruit on top, the cake itself is cheesy and creamy, balanced sweetness with a hint of lemon. The crust is crispy and aromatic. A heavenly dessert deserves your attention.
The quality of the salad bar is excellent, many fresh vegetables and seasonal fruits to select from, quality of the steak is above average but not great. Overall good experience for me.

Cozy little curry shop located at Basement level of è¬å¹´å•†æ¥­å¤§æ¨“, curry tastes ok but I found it a bit too salty, fried chicken is a fail, too much batter and not enough meat. Costs NT$150 per serving is reasonable.

Not a bad burger joint in Taipei, thick beef patty with jalapeno pepper, fresh lettuce and tomato plus a slice of cheese. yummmmm!! Roughly NT$150 for a burger set comes with chips and a drink. not a bad deal.

This so called "Gogoro" shop does not sell electric scooter, instead they sell quality personal hotpot, meat quality and quantity is exceptional, but price is not that friendly for average income earner.

Personally I think this Turkish restaurant tastes not as authentic as other same style restaurant I visited in other country, but probably is due to the fact that they need to infuse with local taste, the seasoning is a bit light, I wish â€¦

This restaurant specialized in making chicken soup, deliciously prepared chicken broth with Chinese medicine makes the end product healthy and aromatic. Price is not too expensive and the service is great.
A fancy noodle restaurant serves delicious Taiwanese style noodles,  both soup and dry noodles. Price is good and the food quality is exceptional.

Loved those little wheel shaped cake where they offer 3 distinct flavors to choose from: Cream (sweet), Red bean (sweet) and white radish (savory). Personally I loved white radish and Red bean.

Only costs NT$12 per cake, come try them all out without hurting your wallet.
Nasty Taiwanese style egg roll filled with pan fried noodle, tastes pretty alright but a bit too oily. NT$70 per serving is also a bit overpriced.

A Dessert look alike shop also sells savory dish... WEIRD! tried their hot tofu with brown sugar ginger tea.

The ginger tea is good, pungent aroma and you can feel the heat when it slide down your throat. Overall not a bad place to have a light dessert.
Mediocre American diner restaurant in Taipei, food quality is ok but high price tag which result in low CP value.

Not a bad Taiwanese fry chicken shop close to NTU, they added garlic and basil into the fryer to boost the aromatic of the chicken, they added pepper salt and a little bit of chili powder to the end product. One bite and you will not visit â€¦

I always come here to buy soft serve cone, and milk tea, I-Mei is a local food producer company, they have built a solid reputation for delivering quality food and trustworthiness since 1934.

They also sell bread and toast here, bread â€¦

One of the few good bagel place I found in Taipei, the bagels they sell here is good and freshly made in store. The crumb is dense and chewy, but still tender enough that can bite through with ease, sadly the outside is lack of a crackly â€¦
Owner of this place always have a grumpy face, but actually they are quite nice, food is tasty and price is not expensive. Pretty good for a quick dinner.
A local delicacy strongly suggest overseas friend should give it a go, located at Ximen area which tourists and young locals like to hang out. Cold noodle and pork mince rice is a must try.
A famous tourist attraction in Taipei where locals come here to seek blessing from God for good health, luck and fortune. It is also a good place to find inner peace and serenity.

I personally think it is one of the best beef noodle shop in town.

Chunky semi-steak like beef bathe in clear or Chinese herb and soy sauce based broth, personally I would recommend clear broth so you can taste the poignant beefiness in â€¦
Healthy and delicious home made meal, reasonably priced and the serving is generous. Must try their curry rice dish. Amazingly good.
What a rip-off NT$180 for a bowl of noodle that you can finish in 2 mouth full. Won't visit again, so disappointed. One extra star for good broth.
Mediocre Taiwanese style restaurant, the price is on the expensive side compare with other similar shops, taste is not bad but nothing special.

Single serving spicy hotpot where the soup is actually drinkable and will not kill your kidney when that delicious, red liquid lava flows down your throat. The pork mince rice and think cut noodle is a must try item too.
Traditional Taiwanese style charcoal baked bread, a little bit sweet sesame crust with spring onion filling, very aromatic and yummy.
Normally I do not drink stuff like this, but I made an exception for this shop today, brown sugar woolong milk tea, not too sweet and made from 100% fresh milk plus chewy pearl, delicious!!

Only 2 noodle selections on the menu but that's all you need, simple and delicious, chewy noodle bathed in homey style soup. Plenty of chopped garlic is provided if you want a stronger taste. About NT$100  per bowl.

If you don't mind the hygiene and interior design of the restaurant, this is a local bento restaurant worth recommending, the pork cutlet is flavorful and delicious, the dry noodle tastes pretty good too. Apart from the presentation of this â€¦
Good location, great coffee and friendly service. A very good place to spend quality time with friends for a relaxing afternoon.
Pretty nice kaffee, friendly boss.
Compact shopping and dinning centre for the local residents, nothing too special for tourists, but more than enough for locals to acquire daily groceries.
Used to eat at this shop very often while I worked around this area,  they make delicious sandwiches on demand with fresh ingredients, price is reasonable and the portion is amazing.
One of the few Thai restaurant in Sydney which provide authentic Thai cuisine, delicious food with friendly service, comfortable and clean environment for people to enjoy gathering time.
Awesome yumcha restaurant at the heart of Melbourne city, very delicious but a little bit pricey. Overall I still enjoyed it.

Often we came here with mates when craving for Thai food hit during our uni years. Normally we think Thai food is spicy, but the dishes from this place is kind of on the sweeter side of the scale. Green curry and pad Thai is sweeter compare â€¦

address: Chatswood Central Precinct 4-6, 1-5 Railway St, Chatswood NSW 2067æ¾³æ´²
content: With the food quality this good and needless to say the bier made by true German, you can "Das Boot" me anytime of the day!! Enjoyed dining at the Bavarian, delicous!

A little fish & chips shop located close to town hall and QVB underground walkway, although most of the menu items are deep fried but you can still taste the freshness of the produce, price is very friendly also compare to other seafood place at Sydney CBD. Great place to visit for a snack, loved it!

Awesome lamb and chicken skewers, famous big plate chicken with handmade style noodle is a must order. Taste is a bit too heavy for my personal taste (a bit too salty). But overall I love the food in this restaurant.
The watermelon cake is amazing, the fruit makes the whole cake much more refreshing and takes the oiliness away from the cream, delicious.

Used to have better quality steak, used to have better price, quantity is about the same as before, still a good place to go for a drink and hearty lunch, but not the same place I used to remember....

Used to come here a lot for a healthy meal and cakes while I was an uni student, after 10 years they still managed to maintain their food quality, portion and taste. This place serve vegetarian food only, Love their wide selection of cakes and ice cream. Delicious and must try their decadent chocolate brownie.
Juicy and flavorful middle eastern kebab meat served with 2 types of sauces, I picked hummus with garlic aioli, plus all the fresh veges, this is one hearty meal hard to forget.
Authentic Italian style, thing crust pizza, very delicious and I enjoyed every bite, the pasta is cooked perfectly also. Highly recommended.
Greek dessert is a bit too sweet for me, personally not a sweet tooth guy but still tried it a couple of times.

address: Kiosk K108/236 Pacific Hwy, Hornsby NSW 2077æ¾³æ´²
content: Excellent service, good quality coffee, exceptional banana cake,  having breakfast there just made my day.
Mediocre Chinese restaurant, the congee is good, wallet friendly price.
Delicious green curry chicken, comfortable seating arrangement and friendly service. Very nice place to have a family dinner or event.

I lived in Maroubra for more than 10 years and this curry shop is one of my favorite in Sydney, their butter chicken and mango chicken is silky smooth and creamy, vegetable korma is aromatic and delicious.
A nice and cozy cafe near Gordon station, they have a good cafe and friendly service.
Cheap and tasty dim sim shop where you can buy and eat on the spot or uncooked ones to take home. price is friendly and very convenient.
A green and friendly cafe which also serves Vietnamese sandwiches, good quality with reasonable price tag, staff is attentive, clean environment.
Delicous Indian style curry place located at Gordon, loved their smooth butter chicken with bread, so good!
Don't really like my thin style ramen noodle, but the broth is good and delicious. not too expensive around $15 per bowl.

address: 273 Old Northern Rd, Castle Hill NSW 2154æ¾³æ´²
content: Pub food that I used to remember, decent steak for that price but mine is a bit too dry, fish and chips is delicious and well made, fresh salad as side. Pretty nice place to grab a drink and dinner with friends or family.

This is one kidney friendly restaurant where the restaurant is not trying to overfeed you with sodium or soy sauce, mild taste for every dish with generous portion. Wallet friendly price and additionally clean and bright open kitchen as â€¦
Well made udon noodle, its firm and will not turn soggy easily even its been sitting in hot bath for a short while, the broth is ok. A enjoyable nice bowl of udon dinner for me.
Mediocre meat quality with above average price tag, salad is fresh and delicious, but overall experience is ok, not very special.
A delicious Taiwanese style dessert street cart located inside TongWah nightmarket, there will be a queue most of the time so it is not too hard to find.

Another cafÃ© has just made into my cafÃ© pocket list, Cho cafÃ© sells quality coffee beans imported from different region around the world, it also has a lab area where you can scent different type of beans before you buy. They also make good â€¦

My chicken spaghetti was under cooked in the first time, the meat was still raw inside. Staff apologized and took it to the kitchen and came back overcooked. They still charged me NT$400ish for that dish. Money wasted!

An already delicious Chinese restaurant mixed with contemporary mindset, delicate tastes crafted from exquisite Seasonings, thoughtful plating decorated with vibrant colors from the freshness of the ingredients which just make the dish even â€¦
If you want to punish your butt, this is a good place to visit, they serve you Sichuan chilli oil noodle and wonton, very delicious and spicy.
I kind of like the meat bun from this shop, steamy hot and round body with thin skin, inside filled with meat, lightly seasoned not too salty or greasy. Delicious.

Cozy, friendly and delicious Japanese cuisine restaurant close to NanJing E. Road and Living Mall (Bade Road), Dishes are not authentic Japanese as it is infused with local tastes and ingredients, but without a doubt every dish is well â€¦

Waw... Everything served in this little restaurant is delicious, loved their knife sliced thick cut noodle, beef noodle soup and their fry rice. Located close to Xintein temple MRT station, price is reasonable and serving portion is generous. Only down side is the service which I can live with.

Underground Chinese restaurant, fancy beef wrapped in rope then roasted to give it a grassy and earthy taste. Tender and delicious. Roast pork Chinese style is a must try too, but overall a little bit over priced and not worth the money.

Pretty awesome hotel on bade road, walking distance to living mall, eastern shopping district and Song Shan Cultural Park. Transportation wise it is very close to NanJing Sanmin MRT station(G18). If you don't have the budget to stay in a ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ fancy hotel, you can give this place a go.
I have already transcended beyond Fashion.

A traditional Taiwanese style dessert shop selling icy cold or hot tofu, or herbal jelly dessert, the toppings are flavorful and delicious especially the taro, my personal favorite. I have been eating here since my childhood, it brings back good old memory.

The name of this Japanese restaurant literally translates to "Meat" in English, which also lives up to its name. They serve you generous amount of meat in every bowl, layers and layers of their tender and juicy pork marinated in Japanese style bbq sauce, absolutely delicious. About NT$150 to 200 per bowl, a must visit.

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Ratchadamri Rd, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10330
content: Big C ... I love you!
Bigger Carrefour supermarket located at Taoyuan City, there is a food court and parking lot available at close proximity.
Good place to shop for chemical ingredient, when you mix knowledge with it, you can create some powerful stuff. But I normally come here to purchase some detergents.

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Rama I Rd, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10330
content: Another great mall in central Bangkok, Siam Discover is a must visit shopping destination for tourists visiting Thailand.

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Rama I Rd, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10330
content: Siam Mall is another beautiful and sinister tourist attraction, its big, comfortable and easy to shop, stop killing my wallet!

Hygienic and modern beef noodle restaurant, serves NT$200 bowl beef noodle, average taste with higher than usual piece tag, recommended only to people who wants to grab a quick bite before travelling to airport.
Expensive instant dry noodle shop, tasty but unfortunately over priced. Wallet is not fat enough sorry!
Tax office is located in the China airline building.

This is like an extended area of your own home, this place allows you to make your own tea or coffee, get your own light snacks and pay your own bill into the cashier (under supervision of course). And when you finish you have to wash your â€¦

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Ratchadamnoen Avenue, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10200
content: Many tourist attractions packed in one big field, it is really easy to get lost in there. Some of the must see building includes Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Grand Royal Palace and much more. It is easy to get here but hard to find the â€¦
Just a typical parking lot, what else I can say about this place .... Hmmmm
Shopping is a breeze here .... If and only if you are loaded with cash. Please don't rape my wallet.
Carrefour you never let me down, a decent size supermarket at Tao yuan city, there is another larger Carrefour located around 15 mins by car but this one still got everything I need here.
An old department store now mainly sells phone accessory or mobile devices. Nothing worth to see if you are not looking for a new case for your phone.
This place got everything ranging from clothes socks to stationary and household utility items, price is cheap and easy to shop.
Located at basement of Living Mall, this is a comfy movie theater and above average equipment which can bring you an excellent visual experience. There is also a food court at close proximity.

Located on the second floor of Watson's drug store and not far away from Xintein temple MRT station, this sushi train restaurant is clean and spacious, food quality is average and the price is reasonable.
Communist might not like you Mr. Chiang but I love you and love your memorial hall.
Korean fashion just not my style, purely personal opinion.
Not much fun in ATT 4 FUN, sad ....
A upsized chain cafe, many seats available with wifi access and power plug, good for business meeting and team catch up.

Single serving spicy hotpot where the soup is actually drinkable and will not kill your kidney when that delicious, red liquid lava flows down your throat. The pork mince rice and think cut noodle is a must try item too.

Little cosy cafe near Ximen area, roomy seating area and the owner is kind and friendly, coffee tastes great worth to spend a quality afternoon here with a book or laptop, wifi is available but power plug is limited.

A high end Korean style bbq restaurant, meat quality is good but they really need to work on their side dishes, refillable sides only works when they taste good. Due to the high price of this restaurant I think you can find better Korean restaurant elsewhere in Taipei.

Pretty awesome noodle house near Ximen, they serve authentic Taiwanese style cold noodle, aromatic sesame dressing with soy sauce and with a little hint of citrus fruit to give the soury vinegar taste, delicious and economical. Come and enjoy.

If you enjoy local delicacy and afraid to try something too exotic, then you can't miss this restaurant located in between Tapei main station and Ximen area. Delicious, inexpensive and authentic. Loved their lightly oil fried tofu, must try.
Such a delicious vegetarian yum cha restaurant, every dishs are well prepared and not too greasy or too salty. The staffs are friendly and attentive.

A little gem hidden inside an alleyway near MRT station selling dumplings and noodle dishes. Clean, inexpensive and air-conditioned so you won't sweat like a pig when you dine here in a hot summer day.

Sometimes you will be surprised what you can find in a small shop, this Vietnamese restaurant sells authentic pho, soury and alittle bit spicy then you can taste the mint from the herb, such a refreshing soup in a hot summer day.
A laksa shop in ximen area, not bad, the soup doesn't have any coconut cream in it so it tastes like Thai Tom yum soup.
A tiny but cosy Korean restaurant locate in an alley near MRT station, food is pretty good and they offer 3 selections of refillable sidedish.

There are not many Korean restaurant in Taipei like this one, I haven't been to Korea myself so can't say it is authentic but the food there is delicious, the kimchi is crisp and spicy, most importantly it's refillable, an inexpensive restaurant good for group of friends.
Delicious japanese curry shop close to TongWah night market, they have an unique black curry which is made with large amount of black pepper, spicy and pungent absolutely delicious.
The original one close to Dongmen MRT station is better.
Clean, bright and delicious Taiwanese style fry chicken shop, they fried the chicken with sweet basil which adds an aromatic flavour.
A small and cosy burger joint located close to Taiwan national university, delicious food, big serving, refillable drinks, a typical student restaurant which everyone would love. Highly recommended.
Home sweet home, nicely managed and maintained complex in Chai wan area. Under the complex there is a compact shopping area with a varieties of restaurants.
Pretty decent and traditional Taiwanese restaurant, clean, inexpensive and delicious. The sesame sauce noodle is so delicious I regret I ordered the small portion rather than the big size one.
Food was OK here a bit pricy compare with other similar place.

A special cafe near the old street, they mixed western coffee with old Chinese medicine like sun dried orange peel to give it a hint of citrus taste. They also offer delicious cakes and light savory food. Strongly suggest overseas friends to give it a try.
Generous amount of fillings, crispy outside shell. A dessert which is not too sweet, NT$15 to $20 each, must try this delicious snack.
Unique type of noodle dish I used to eat when I was a little kid. Brings back good old memory.

not a typical seafood market, its clean, hygienic and interior is designed with a modern twist. Seafood is fresh and nicely cooked. Lastly I think the items are reasonably priced, it is dependent on what you actually ordered.
Excellent location, great interior design, nicely brewed coffee and delicious cakes selection, one star short for only serves dessert and no light savory meal.
Beef is well braised and cooked, stock is a bit oily for me and below average noodle, price is a bit too expensive, roughly around NT$200+ for a bowl of beef noodle.
Great shopping experience, got everything you need in one place. Got a massive food court down at level 1 for the locals and international tourists.
Seriously!? You are living on an small island nation, you don't need a car especially in Taipei. Take MRT instead.

Great place to be if you want to have some exercise during a warm sunny day. Able to view Taipei 101 in full and take photo with it like a professional tourist here with ease. Clean walking trail with many friendly people.
Clean environment, mediocre food, higher than usual price tag compare with similar style restaurant, overall ok but not recommended.

address: à¸ªà¸§à¸™à¸ˆà¸•à¸¸à¸ˆà¸±à¸à¸£ Kamphaeng Phet 2 Rd, à¹à¸‚à¸§à¸‡ à¸¥à¸²à¸”à¸¢à¸²à¸§ Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900æ³°åœ‹
content: The biggest weekend market I have ever visited, this is a shopping heaven on Earth for both men and women. The quality of some merchandise here are lower compare with big brands but the price is definitely friendlier and can even get lower if you are willing to bargain with the seller. A true 5 star shopping experience.
Average price BBQ rice restaurant near tongwah night market,  BBQ beef and pork are delicious and the vegetable curry tastes pretty good too but nothing too special.
Not a typical noodle house in Taipei, taste is not bad but price is a bit unfriendly.
Well established department store used to be called "Pacific Sogo" now has been acquired by Far Eastern Group.
Korean fashion not my cup of tea, find your own style and don't be a try hard.
Pretty nice mackers in Taipei, clean and spacious.

address: Tambon Saen Suk, Amphoe Mueang Chon Buri, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20130æ³°åœ‹
content:
Close Nonagon Market, you feel like walking into a fantasy.

This cafe is built around 2 large trees, the cafe is clean and spacious with outdoor seating available, although they do not have menu in English, their staffs are very attentive â€¦
Quality vegetarian restaurant near Xingtian Temple MRT station, the restaurant is spacious and tidy, food tastes great and not too heavy or greasy. Delicious.

Award winning noodle house in Taipei, best knife sliced noodle I have tried in Taiwan, thicker cut noodle makes it harder to get soggy and keeps its al dente form for longer. The broth is light and flavorful. 5 stars, highly recommended.

address: Muang Pattaya, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150æ³°åœ‹
content:
What happen in Pattaya, stay in Pattaya... this is the place were it all began.

Word of advise: Don't be a fool and wrap your tool!

address: à¸«à¸¡à¸¹à¹ˆà¸—à¸µà¹ˆ 10 144/239 Thanon Thap Phraya, Muang Pattaya, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150æ³°åœ‹
content:
Great view and nice location, the facility inside the complex needs some improvement. Overall had a great time staying in this condo in Pattaya.

I found this place via Airbnb, the price is reasonable and the owner is very friendly and responsive.

address: æ³°åœ‹ Chang Wat Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Amphoe Bang Pa-in, Tambon Ban Len, à¸–à¸™à¸™à¸›à¸£à¸²à¸ªà¸²à¸—à¸—à¸­à¸‡ é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 13160
960 962 Phetchaburi Rd, Khwaeng Makkasan, Khet Ratchathewi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10400æ³°åœ‹
content: Waw... this is the best Hainan chicken rice I have ever tried in my life, this is even better than the one I tried in Singapore. OMG! and it only costs 40 b.

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Soi Sukhumvit 19, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10110
content: The toilet in this shopping center is amazing, try to pee once in every level and you will understand what I am trying to express.

address: Highway 32 Frontage Rd., Tambon Han Tra, Amphoe Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Chang Wat Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya 13000æ³°åœ‹
content: This seafood market located somewhat close to Ayutthaya has one of the  freshest and biggest prawn I have ever tasted in Thailand. This is not a tourist attraction therefore most of the shops here does not have English menu, but if you are â€¦

address: æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Charoen Krung Rd, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10120
content: A harbor side night market/entertainment square where many tourists and local people came here to enjoy and relax.

address: Asok Montri Rd, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Khet Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110æ³°åœ‹
content: A traditional market located close to Asoke BTS station, many local people came here for lunch and quick shopping visit, the food here is cheap and authentic.

address: à¸«à¸¡à¸¹à¹ˆà¸—à¸µà¹ˆ 4 196 Khlong Tho Rd, Tambon Pratuchai, Amphoe Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Chang Wat Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya 13000æ³°åœ‹
content:
A historical heritage site with a fascinating tale which tracks back more than 200 years ago.

This site is located about 70 km North of Bangkok, it is a famous tourist attraction and the temples are scattered around the area. 

Hiring a â€¦

address: Khwaeng Pathum Wan, Khet Pathum Wan, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10330æ³°åœ‹
content:
Chilli alert:
This authentic style restaurant serves up some of the spiciest dishes I have encountered in Bangkok, but put chilli aside, this place serves up delicious and well resented Thai dishes. Highly recommended.

address: 139/1 Soi Sukhumvit 21, Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Khet Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110æ³°åœ‹
æ³°åœ‹ Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, Ratchadamri Rd, é‚®æ”¿ç¼–ç : 10330

place: Jap Jap Bikini Craft Beer Cafe Bar é¤é…’é¤¨
content: Not a bad bar and cafe style restaurant located close to TPE main station, love their logo which is a fine and sexy a**. Food wise is pretty decent, taste good, price is a bit high but i think its reasonable due to the quality and quantity they serve.

Hard to review this place, the food is ok, I kind of like their sticky rice ball, perfect portion for breakfast but expensive in price. Egg roll is under delivered and the steamed bun is just a failure. Overall will not recommend this place.

There are a few shops selling "Som tum" (green papaya salad" at tong wah night market, but this one is the best. Owner Joky is a Thai woman who has lived in Taiwan for a long time and she made each salad fresh to order. She is friendly and â€¦
Love their kimchi side dish, I haven't been to Korea myself so not sure if it's authentic, but without a doubt it is delicious. Spicy, flavorful and crispy, goes well with steamy hot riceğŸš.
Not the best place to have Taiwanese style beef noodle, but this place tastes alright and the price is reasonable.

Modern, clean and no time limit HK style yum cha restaurant, good to place have great food and catch up with friends without having time pressure. Dishes are delicious and inexpensive roughly around TW$88 to $100 per dish, restaurant charges TW$30 per head for teacup fee.
Pretty nice and compact cafe shop close to daan road and xinyi road intersection, smooth and aromatic latte. Excellent way to start your day.

This Taiwanese style fried chicken street vendor is one of my favorite place to go when craving for naughty snack kicks in. I can't guarantee on hygiene but I definitely can guarantee you on the taste, recommend fried sweet potato, pop corn chicken and sticky rice sausage. Cheap and yummy.

This place is specializing in rice ball, "Onigiri" in Japanese, "fan tuan" in Mandarin. Fresh and delicious, the owner makes it on demand. Steaming but not too hot rice with wide range of delicious fillings you can choose from, I recommend salmon, black pepper beef.
Coffee latte is good, next time can try their food.
A small and fresh fruit juice bar at underground of ding hao food court. Healthy and delicious.
Delicious Taiwanese style meat ball shop located close to night market, lightly fried meat ball with special sauce and coriander mixed well with each other.
Delicate Chinese herbal soup, nutritious and delicious for some people who can handle Chinese medicine. A little bit over priced due to the serving portion.
Great place to hang out with friends and enjoy delicious and authentic Indian cuisine. The curry is filled with vibrant flavor, creamy and spicy goes well with naan bread.
Delicious fried pork with Shanghai style vegetable rice, price is a bit high but I guess it is the norm considering it's Geo location.
The wonton here is massive and delicious, 5 of them can make an adult male full, highly recommend the big wonton with soup.
This friendly bakery is just outside XingTian Temple MRT station, they serve freshly baked bread daily and tastes delicious. Strongly recommend the bread with cheese and nuts in it. yummy!
love this quaint restaurant with a big tree at close proximity, it makes their food feel more natural and fresh but as a matter of fact they do serve up some nice dishes.
Not the best place to get quality coffee but it's the good place to have some quiet personal time with a book on your hand or simply clear your mind by daydreaming.
Used to like their bread products but after the central kitchen closed down incident, I hardly shop here anymore.
Excellent pull pork and beef brisket, kind and outgoing owner, had a great experience there and will definitely go back again.
Why can female spent so much time in place like this .... ridiculous
I do not eat blood jelly, but their chicken Maryland bento is delicious.
Nothing too special about this shop, just a typical chain bakery.
A nice shopping center specializing kidware, a place where you can take your little one to have some fun. There is also a movie theater and food court at underground area.
HQ of Nanshan insurance company formally part of the AIG group. There is a Starbucks at lobby area.
Underground shopping walkway interconnected with Taipei MRT system, a convenient way to walk around eastern shopping district in a rainy day.

A quality and quite cafe shop located close to Xingtien Temple. Loved their fresh salad which is hard to find anywhere else in Taiwan. crisp lettuce and rocket, fragrant sun dried tomato and olive, everything is brought together by a light layer of cheese and mayo dressing. Delicious!
Pretty good dessert shop selling Taiwanese sweet tofu, most of their menu items are served ice cold, but they can also make some of their dishes hot.
Must try their spicy wonton, fragrant spicy sauce goes extremely well with their delicious wonton, you can choose between meat or prawn wonton.

Food is good but not very special, however if you take 'price' into the equation, this shop deserves a 4 star rating, cheap, yummy and traditional, recommend for anyone who wants to grab a quick bite.
Luxury interior, excellent service, convenient location, more suitable for business travellers.
Got everything you need under one roof, a wholesale style supermarket where you can buy everyone in bulk.
Nice dishes, delicious souffle pancake, comfy interior but a little bit over price.
I was not a fan of HK style bbq pork till I tried this place, the meat is tender, juicy and flavourful, the whole dish is not greasy like other bbq places, absolutely delicious.
Not a bad HK yum cha restaurant located at SK department store underground food court, must try the bbq pork bun, taste pretty amazing.
A cheaper alternative compare with the famous Taiwanese restaurant Ding Tai Fong, the steamed soup bun is still pretty tasty.
High class hotel with excellent facilities and well trained staffs.
Nice and quite little prison like back yard.
Location wise is not that convenient, closest MRT station is about 20 mins away by foot.
Xiao Mi headquarter in Taiwan, located on the second floor close to Xingtian temple MRT station. Nicely decorated feels like Apple store.
Delicious, inexpensive, authentic Taiwanese restaurant, this place is one of my pocket list of restaurant when overseas friend visits Taiwan. Must try and highly recommended.

Delicious hand made vegetable roll from fresh ingredients, suitable for vegetarian or anyone who seek for a healthy snack. You can taste natural sweetness from the carrot and lettuce, crunchiness from slices of crispy apple, NTD 40 per roll, highly recommended.
Hand made HK dim sum shop, taste pretty good.

Special vegetarian restaurant decorated like a classy bar arrangement, dishes are well prepared and delicious, pasta is well cooked and the Thai style salad is also amazing, they also serve crafted beer which I did not order this time round.

Delicious spicy wonton shop located at ding hao shopping center underground food court area. This shop serves noodle and wonton dishes but they only have one pot to cook. Therefore they take turns and cook orders by batch so expect long waiting time.

This bread shop was there when I was a kid, same location but had nicer interior design. The bread is not bad but I like their cooked food section where you can buy braised chicken, tofu, seaweed and more.
Mediocre mini hot pot in eastern suburb, relatively cheap in price considering it's Geo location, generous amount of vegetable, good meat quality but the only downside side I think is the soup.
Comfortable seating, bright and cosy interior good coffee and cakes. Love it.
This south eastern Asian style restaurant serves pretty good pho and stir fry rice dishes. Price is pretty reasonable also around NT$100 for each dish.
Came here for a conference, very satisfied with equipment, friendly staffs and delicious finger food.
Friendly service, excellent coffee, very nice and comfortable seating arrangement, a very good place to spend a quality afternoon with friends and family.
What a lovely day to indulge yourself with an aromatic latte with a well baked Egg tart and creamy cheesecake, absolutely divine.

Jaimie, your food is ok, unlike the dishes you presented on television show over dressed with your 3 famous seasoning, salt, pepper and olive oil. Your staff is well trained and have excellent service, but I am so disappointed with the price, my wallet died after checkout.
Their specialty is pineapple bun, you can select with filling or without, you can also get dark black one made from squid ink.
Traditional Taiwanese food restaurant serving steamed hot buns to fry pork cutlet rice, they have a desert section where you can order icy cold silky soft tofu with beans or other sides.
Underground dumpling restaurant, always packed with customers, the food is awesome and the price is cheap.
60 bucks for a bottle of beer, around 50 bucks for a BBQ meat skewer how good is that, Friendly staffs  with excellent service. delicious and wallet friendly, good place to hangout with friends.
Buffet style Chinese restaurant where you pay by the weight of your food, but they did not clearly state how much per unit. I think it's overpriced and too greasy.
After the traditional market moved from the street into the new building, it wasn't the way I used to remember anymore. It became too commercialized.
Delicious Chinese bun, cheap and yummy especially the brown sugar Okinawa mantou
Authentic taiwanese bento style food, food presentation is not fancy and taste is not high class but this place brings back my childhood memory.
Mechanically knife slice noodle house, broth is well made and well seasoned, noodle is cooked to Al dente, not soggy at all, delicious.
Comfortable double decker cafe on the main road, coffee quality is alright similar to Starbucks but the price is little bit friendlier.

Spacious and convenient supermarket located right outside XingTian Temple MRT station. Many tourists visit this place to purchase fruit, snacks and drinks. This place also provide coffee at a discounted price.

Excellent dumpling shop who knows how to make a simple dish taste great. Lightly seasoned filling covered with silky smooth dumpling wrapper. Something will make you grin and wont hurt your wallet's feeling.
Modern decoration with oriental style furniture, unique noodle soup great texture and loved their beef don style rice very delicious.
Award winning bakery selling freshly baked breads, cakes and biscuits, they also have a section selling steamed HK style dim sim and braised meat and vege. Delicious and clean.

Same as other main station around the world, it is the hub of all the public transports, buses, MRT, Airport express, trains to anywhere around the nation can be boarded here. There are also many retail shops selling cakes and biscuits for â€¦
Delicious baked sweet bun made from special dough, the texture is dense but not hard and it has a sweet sensation aftertaste in your mouth. mung beans or sesame flavor are my personal pick.
They have a bakery downstairs and a cafe restaurant upstairs. They serve quality cafe style food ranging from sandwiches to beef steak which will fatten your waist but slim down ur wallet.
Traditional taiwanese pastry snack, greasy but taste pretty good once in a while.
Small and compact university campus, loving the environment and vibe here, brings me back to my uni age....
Spacious lobby, friendly concierge and helpful staffs excellent service.
This place is a fail, food is not fresh, it's greasy, salty and expensive. Definitely deserves zero star, but will give 1 star for contributing to economy.

Delicious handmade mochi street cart located close to Xingtian temple, mochi's were made to order to ensure that you get the freshest product. 6 flavors to choose from for $10 a piece, must try highly recommended.

A special tiny bakery makes their bread dough without egg, milk, butter and sugar. Sounds very healthy and tastes just like ordinary bread with reasonable price . For healthy food seekers you might want to give this shop a try.
A traditional shop serves Taiwanese cuisine from braised pork mince rice to fish soup, taste is great but hygiene wise needs a great improvement.

Not the best Japanese restaurant in town but certainly not the worst, the food is not bad but has too much Taiwanese influence which made their food not very Japanese. Personally I like their oden, very delicious.
Delicious traditional spring onion pancake Taiwanese style, order it with egg and you will have famous egg roll. Must try and highly recommended.
I only tried their bread at bakery side and never been to their cafe side, the bread is quite alright a little bit expensive but tasty.
What can I say about Starbucks... Hmm it's always packed, below average coffee, above average price tag, excellent service and extremely comfy seating area. ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ ğŸŒŸ period.
A true 24 hrs bookstore, not overly commercialized, a good place to shop for quality books from multiple countries. There is a cafe and food court down stairs to service your cravings.

Hygienic and fresh, this lovely vegetarian restaurant serve healthy dishes ranging from lightly stir friend green vege, steamed pumpkin and sweet potato to sweet and chilli meat like tofu, delicious but a little bit pricy. They have a on going special where you get 10% off if you make Monday your meat free day.
Very delicious lamb cuisine served in hot pot style, price is reasonable, wide selection of choices including hotpot, noodle soup and rice dish, the only downside is the service, it could be better.
Shanghai style Chinese restaurant, dishes are a bit greasy and salty but that's the characteristic of Shanghai cuisine. Overall not a bad place to eat and experience different style of cooking.
Inexpensive local cuisine near longshan temple, not overly salty or greasy.
Great Italian cuisine with tasty pizza and pasta selection
A compact food court for working people and students, it offers a wide ranges of different cuisine and a price tag which won't hurt your wallet.
A pretty nice noodle and dumpling shop where the serving is generous with friendly price tag, noodle and dumpling tastes great especially their tomato beef noodle soup. Absolutely delicious.
A cafe style restaurant specialized in green tea products, their mocha latte is amazing.
HK style restaurant serves up bbq pork rice, HK noodle and dim sum. food is not authentic and tastes dull.

This cafe is one of the few place I will recommend for getting a coffee in Taipei. The milk foam is creamy smooth which complements well with the aromatic espresso. I am just glad that I finally found a place where I can get quality cup of coffee before hectic work day starts. â˜•
Delicious Taiwanese street food, you don't have a wide range of items to select from but everything is well made and delicious.
A traditional Taiwanese backery serves good quality bread and cakes. The price is cheap and taste is delicious.
A subsidiary of Wowprime group, the food quality and level of service provided by their staff is excellent, in terms of the taste nothing too special about this place.
Welcome welcomes you, a place where you can get all the essentials under one roof.
High price, mediocre food, I am confident you can find a much better Japanese restaurant in Taipei. Not worth visiting.

Very traditional Hong Kong style restaurant located in Taipei city, the food is alright, personally not my cup of tea, the price is a little high but reasonable due to the physical location of the shop.
A quite and cosy cafe near ren ii road, they have excellent coffee and waffle recommended for sweet lovers.

Apart from German engineering, Germans can make 2 things great, Beer and Pork Knuckle and this place has both. Absolutely love the dining experience here, German people are kind and talkative especially when they are drunk.
Clean room, friendly staffs, and very close to U bahn I loved the breakfast here.
A bargain pig out noodle shop, this place serves you a mountain of food for just a portion of the price. The food is delicious, not a bad place to be when you are starving.
Food is ok but the price is very friendly for a restaurant opened in Ren ii road area.
The service and quality of the coffee is guaranteed by the brand, convenient location and always packed with people.
Lighting is a bit dark and air conditioning is not as strong as it should be coffee quality is average but staff there provides good service.
The only place where you can apply for your personal credit report in Taiwan. Good service and easy to find.

Absolutely amazing, one of my top pick for getting an authentic Taiwanese style beef noodle in Taipei, the broth is clean and perfectly flavored, thick cut style noodle which sucks up more soup per mouth full and lastly the beef is soft and tender. Highly recommended.
Delicious and wallet friendly, this shop bakes their produce so it's non greasy and the filling is well seasoned. Highly recommend their chiv pocket pastry.
Mediocre food and price not very special I reckon.
A new compact size Carrefour supermarket, way smaller than the original Carrefour which is located a few blocks away from this shop but this shop serves its purpose.
Good place to have catch up with friends or doing some work on your laptop, this cafe offers free internet access. Down side is it is always packed in the weekend.
Overrated and overpriced, TW$220 for a bowl of beef noodle which has similar taste to some instant noodle brands you can get in convenience store.
Good quality cafe style restaurant serves sandwiches and burgers. A bit pricy.
A bit pricy compare with other noodle shop, portion is small for an young adult.

A small shop on the side of a busy road, serves freshly baked chiv pastry box and traditional Chinese buns. They baked all the products and not pan fried so it's not greasy and with smoky aroma. Delicious and wallet friendly snack you can eat on the go.
Affordable and yummy yakiniku don rice restaurant much better than yoshinoya
Friendly staffs easy to access resources
Just a small park where you can rest under the shade from trees
Serves good coffee with free Wi-Fi access and no time limit. Good place for friends catch up or trying to get something done if you don't want to stay at home.
Excellent service,  very happy with Corpred!

Delicate French infused restaurant offers 5 course set menu for dinner (soup with house baked bread, salad, entree, main and dessert with coffee or tea). Each course is well presented and delicious. BYO is allowed with additional NT$50 glass charge per head.
Don't like it
Excellent Chinese restaurant for group dinner, not recommended for 1 or 2 people, must try there chicken soup, the broth is so thick that is almost like cream milk.
Authentic taiwanese night market fill with traditional Taiwanese style street food. Famous for tourists and locals for a casual night out to feast your tummy.
Delicious Indian vegan restaurant, 2 main selections are curry rice or baked sandwiches.
I don't really understand what's with all the fuss about this place, it's so ordinary and nothing special about the HK style bbq pork or chicken they serve.
Welcome welcomes you with big welcome greeting.
Overall a delicious Chinese restaurant good for group meal, dishes a bit too salty but goes well with a bowl of steamy white rice.
Clean and comfy Thai restaurant. Loved their Thai milk tea and chilli fried chicken, would love to try their Thai hotpot next time round.
Decadent and good quality cake shop, must try their black forest cake and cheese cake. Yummmmm
Excellent quality vegetarian restaurant in the heart of eastern suburb in Taipei. This gem is hidden in the little alley way. You won't regret after you tried it.
I believe UNIQLO is roughly the same across the globe, and has all the best clothing UNIQLO can offer.
Small Mazda dealer with 4 cars on display.

address: Guang Fu north Road No.12,Fl.1 105, No. 12å…‰å¾©åŒ—è·¯æ¾å±±å€å°åŒ—å¸‚105
content: Delicious Indian cuisine excellent quality and authentic. Price are higher than usual but overall pretty good experience there.
Everything you need is right here! Welcome supermarket welcomes you!

If treasure belongs to someone who seeks, then this place is your treasure chest. It's an old style shopping center filled with goodies and there is a nice arcade at top floor and a compact food court at the bottom. This place is highly recommended for travellers.
Excellent vegetarian restaurant especially their gourmet pizza, yummy !!!!
Wide range of local and international publications to choose from under one roof, it is also a good place to shop for souvenior for friends and family.
A good place to shop but not for food.

Well decorated Japanese bbq restaurant close to Zhongshan MRT station, wide ranges of delicious bbq selections, don't forget to wash it down with few pint of ice cold beer and punish your toilet tomorrow.
Average beverages with above average price tag.
Tasty fried pork cutlet with curry sauce, good service and clean and comfy environment. A bit pricy tho!
A small and cosy cafe hidden on the second floor near Ximen area, excellent coffee, however the choice for food is limited. Come and check out their artwork collection.
It's called great buy supermarket for a reason.
A good and relaxing place to rent books & DVD.
A very nice theater with its own theme, love their interior decor design, 5 star for my first movie experience there.
Excellent coffee, must try their dessert next time round. Definitely will revisit again soon. Love their European decor style. Feels warm and cozy.
You are not there for the food or service, you are there to experience real Hong Kong culture and traditional Yumcha
Loved the HK style roast pork from here, tastes amazing but other dishes a bit too greasy price is above average, my overall experience is good.
Delicious traditional Taiwanese pancake especially one with white radish filling, cheap and yummy a bit oily coz it's pan fried. Overall a must try dish in Taipei.
A very nice and cozy vegetarian restaurant close to night market. the price is reasonable and the portion is more than enough to make you full!
Noodle and pan fried dumpling is great here but its a bit pricey and greasy!
Theme restaurant for toilet lovers, everything here is poo related! Food here does not taste great but certainly not poopy also!
The dumpling here is ok, but do not expect too much!
Similar to welcome supermarket, selection is roughly the same. Overall good experience in pxmart
Professional staff with friendly attitude, the supermarket is smaller compare with other sites but it got everything you need.
Good quality coffee I tried the espresso and it was prepared nicely
Excellent service and good quality coffee a nice place to go if you crave for an afternoon tea with style

Used to be packed with buyers and resellers to buy clothing for their personal or business needs, it's quieter now but still a good place to find hidden treasure if you are willing to spend time to dig.
The beef noodle and Taiwanese style meat pie is pretty good, the price is acceptable for a clean and hygienic restaurant at daan road
Inexpensive pasta restaurant with generous serving, the taste is ok with many different sauces you can select from. Do not expect to get Al dente pasta here.
A good place to read or rent books and DVD movies, it got a wide variety of comics, novels, magazines and movies.
A good place to visit if you want to have a relaxing afternoon with high quality tea to drink and accompany by warm spring breeze
A nice Japanese izakaya style restaurant in the heart of eastern district in Taipei, got many alcohol selection, good place for after work dinner with colleagues or friends gathering
Must try the chiv pocket and spring onion pancake here, it's delicious, healthy, non oily and inexpensive. Highly recommended even for tourists
Clean chain cafe in Taiwan with comfortable sitting arrangement, similar to Starbucks with friendlier price tag.
Mediocre Japanese ramen shop, nothing pretty special
A cosy cafe with warm ambience, drinks and desserts here are delicious, a good place to have group catch up with friends. Reservation is recommended
Clean and cosy place for a quick bite they also sell baked bread in store
Cheap and yummy beef noodle ad plenty of sides you can choose from
Similar to Starbucks with lesser decoration on site but the price and taste of the coffee is much better
Did not try the food here but the milk tea selection they offer here is amazing.
One stop shop for all 3C lovers recommend to do research online, create shopping list and come here while stone cold cash to settle for your 3C fantasy
It's forever 21 cheap clothing and females accessory shop
Street style seafood restaurant mainly serves prawn dish, the food is average
High class department store which has most of the luxury brand under one roof
Nice pasta and risotto lots of piggy decor
Delicious steam dumplings and Taiwanese style meat pies, they also serve up generous portion of rice and noodle dish.
Sells many Korean instant noodle and Japanese confectionary and biscuit
Noodle is ok but the dumpling here is delicious
Pass
A compact ÃŸupermarket in the heart of the residential area where you can obtain most of the essentials you might need
If u want to have a healthy meal, this place will serve you a pretty yummy and light vegetarian meal.
Cosy and clean convenient store which also has sitting area
Loved the spring onion cake from this place a must try dish, highly recommended
Very nice and cosy vegetarian bakery
Very nice sport bar
Excellent cafe and it's a must go if you are a cake lover
It's just too cute to be eaten too shy too shy
Mediocre cafe style food close to NTU, one other thing to note if you are considering to try out this place, the meal quantity and price they charge is not proportional
I hate that clown who made me fat when I was young but just can't resist his burgers ... Soooo good
The yum cha restaurant inside brothers hotel is quite nice it's not a place you must visit but the food is worth trying
The quality of the bread and cakes here is mediocre but the price is pretty good compare with other bakery
Also known as Tong-Wah street night market, this is a compact night market locate close to Xinyi CBD plenty food and clothing shops here. A good place to visit for a relaxing night out
High quality yum cha restaurant must try prawn dumpling and raddish cake
Normally this place hosts event for military personnel serving in Taiwan army or retired veterans, it has a accommodation service and restaurant which services excellent food with good price
A cosy Starbucks inside the Cathay United Bank building ground floor
A great and cosy cafe
HK yum cha style restaurant, I find this restaurant just OK nothing special
Don't like the food and service here you can enjoy better food and service elsewhere with the price you pay here
Gotta try the sesame dessert bun which looks like a pumpkin
A lively market in the heart of Munich city, it's a must go place if you visit Munich
A compact sport center that offers most of workout equipment you may need
Vegetarian only, if you are looking for a healthy and hygienic meal option, this is the place
This place sells professional coffee maker and they also serve good quality coffee
Very delicious pizza joint, good for group dinner or to satisfy your pizza craving
Underground supermarket
This place is amazing
Loved the chiv box here, a must try if you visit here. Price is above average but the service and quality of food is worth the money
This night market is close to university filled with various retail shops and local restaurants a good place to visit for tourists
A good place to be when you want a mini hot pot in a cold winter night
Taipei landmark, with shops and food court inside must see

address: ç¾éº—éƒ½å¤§å»ˆ Shop 24 Ground Floor & Shop 42 1st Floor, 62 Nathan Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, é¦™æ¸¯
content: This place is already famous for tourist without additional posting, the cookies they sell taste nice but a bit pricy
Average breakfast shop serves burgers sandwiches and egg rolls
Taiwanese style bakery serves with quality breads and buns
High class Thai restaurant, good quality seafood dishes
Serves one of the best pepper spicy chicken dish
It's mackers nothing special
Recommend it's deep pan pizza yummmmm!! But pricy
Love this little Thai restaurant, must visit
Love the pan fried dumpling here one of the best and the price is just amazing
A very nice Japanese yakitori restaurant with a selection of Tasty food
It's mackers and will always be mackers
Well managed sport center with everything you need
Yummy noodle and dumpling
Average food with below average service
High quality bread with quality ingredients 5 stars hands down
Good food with a mediocre price tag
Decadent omelette rice and reasonably priced
High quality spicy hotpot with many choice of meat and beverages
